title: Meta got bumped off world's top 20 companies' list, thanks to Zuckerberg's relentless metaverse pursuit
text: Meta's share price tanked nearly 25% on Thursday, taking its market cap down to $263 billion. It is now the world's 27th most valuable company.

title: Meta Fined $24.6M for Violating Washington Campaign Finance Disclosure Law
text: The fine is the maximum allowed, for more than 800 violations of the state law.

title: 20X Winners Coming From
text: Is crypto a “buy” again?

title: How Meta Became the Market's Biggest Value Trap
text: You would be hard-pressed to find a more contentious stock than Meta Platforms Inc. ( META , Financial) in the value investing world right now. Facebook's parent company used to be one of the most popular stocks in the world, riding the wave of its social media dominance and raking in cash from advertisers.

title: Tech Stocks Continue To Slide After Meta Meltdown; 3 Recent Breakouts Trigger Sell Signals
text: The stock market ended sharply mixed Thursday. The tech-heavy Nasdaq composite sold off, as Meta Platforms crumbled on weak earnings.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's Fortune Dropped $11 Billion Today–And Is Down $100 Billion Since Meta's Stock Peaked
text: Shares of Meta plunged Thursday after the company reported dismal quarterly earnings late on Wednesday.

title: Meta is in trouble
text: A day after weighing in with its third quarter earnings report, Meta is flailing. The company formerly known as Facebook was in trouble Thursday after uninspiring numbers and an apparent lack of faith in Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse vision sent its shares plunging by 25%.

title: Everything to Know About Meta and Google's Earnings Miss
text: The FAANG stocks consisting of Facebook parent Meta Platforms ( META , Financial), Amazon ( AMZN , Financial), Apple ( AAPL , Financial), Netflix ( NFLX , Financial) and Alphabet's ( GOOG , Financial)( GOOGL , Financial) Google were previously thought to be untouchable by the market mayhem. In 2022, however, these stocks have faced a series of detrimental headwinds, driven by a combination of macroeconomic factors and company issues.

title: Meta Is Betting Billions That AI Will Fix Its Advertising Business
text: Meta is going through a massive investment cycle as growth grinds to a halt.

title: Meta shares dip is proof metaverse plan never really had legs
text: Despite announcement avatars would stop floating around, Zuckerberg's virtual reality gamble is not paying off

title: Meta spending slams Facebook stock, but here are the chip stocks that are benefiting
text: Data-center stocks buoyed an otherwise down chip sector Thursday as shares of Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. cratered on torn-in-half profits and a hike in capital spending to fuel Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse ambitions, prompting one analyst to ask if server chips can only go up now.

title: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock Gets a Boost on Meta Platforms Spending Plans
text: Like a football player about to get obliterated performing a lateral pass to a teammate, Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) got the raw end of the action. However, Meta's sacrificial act helped underscore the contrarian bullish narrative of semiconductor specialist Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA ).

title: Meta loses its 'buy' rating from Morgan Stanley after blowing past spending forecasts and casting doubt on strong cash flow in 2023
text: Morgan Stanley downgraded Meta stock to equal-weight from overweight and slashed its price target to $105 from $205.

title: Facebook parent Meta stock plummets, CEO Zuckerberg sees net worth sink
text: Zuckerberg owns more than 350 million shares of Meta's stock, according to its latest proxy statement. Its shares have tumbled approximately 70% year to date.

title: Why Meta Platforms Stock Was Down More than 20% Earlier Today
text: Wall Street and the Facebook owner are not on the same page about how to navigate this economy.

title: A strategy that follows analysts' herd-like behavior lets you know when it will be favorable to pile into Meta's stock again
text: Don't buy shares of Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. until at least some Wall Street analysts begin to revise their earnings estimates.

title: Facebook used to be a Big Tech giant — now Meta isn't even in the top 20 most valuable U.S. companies
text: Meta shares are down more than 20% on Thursday, the second time this year they've collapsed after an earnings report.

title: Meta employees told to ‘put in 200% effort' to protect jobs as layoffs loom: report
text: "Zuck's message was loud and clear: You have three months to prove your worth," one worker said.

title: Facebook Parent Meta Shares Fall to New Multiyear Lows
text: Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. lost more than one-fifth of its market value Thursday morning, or about $76 billion, following the company's quarterly earnings report.

title: META Stock Is Plunging. What Comes Next?
text: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) stock crashed after reporting another down quarter. Net income fell by half to $4.4 billion, $1.64/share.

title: Meta Platforms Stock Hits 7-Year Low After Earnings
text: You might have heard that Facebook-parent Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB) is tanking this morning after earnings, last seen down 22.5% to trade at $100.60.

title: Will Facebook Spending Spree On Metaverse Boost Arista, Nvidia, Ciena?
text: Facebook-parent Meta Platforms' spending spree to build the "metaverse" could provide upside for makers of advanced technology products. The post Will Facebook Spending Spree On Metaverse Boost Arista, Nvidia, Ciena?

title: Meta likely past peak TikTok risk but massive spending on Metaverse poses challenge, analysts say
text: Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB) is likely to be past peak risk from its competitor TikTok but the company faces challenges from its massive spending on the Metaverse and the weak macroeconomic backdrop, according to analysts from Oppenheimer & Co Inc. Following the release of Meta's 3Q results on Wednesday, Oppenheimer analysts rate the stock 'Outperform' but lowered their 12 to 18-month price target from $190 to $140 due to the company's much higher investments in Facebook Reality Labs and its conservative 2023 operating expenses (opex) guidance which assumes 18 x 23E GAAP earnings per share excluding real estate consolidation expenses.  Meta stock plunged almost 24% in after-hours trading overnight, falling to about $98.90 per share shortly before the market opened on Thursday.

title: Meta spent $45 billion on stock buybacks last year at $330 a share. The stock is worth $100 today after a post-earnings crash.
text: Mark Zuckerberg's social-media giant has plowed about $91 billion into buybacks since 2017, paying a sharp premium to Meta's current stock price.

title: The biggest tech stocks have lost $3 trillion in market cap the last one year
text: It's worth noting these Big Tech names are still trading higher than the 52-week lows set on Oct. 13, when the S&P 500 dove to $3,491.

title: Meta's stock plunge to below $100 on track to wipe out more than $80 billion in market cap
text: Shares of Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. META, -5.59% plunged 23.6% in premarket trading Thursday, in the wake of disappointing third-quarter results, putting them on track to trade below the $100 mark after the opening bell for the first time since February 2016. The implied price decline ahead of the open would wipe out about $81.2 billion worth of market capitalization from the social media giant to about $263.0 billion, which would knock it down by eight notches on the list of most valuable S&P 500 companies, to 21st from 13th.

title: Meta Platforms: Disaster Quarter But Deeply Undervalued
text: Meta Platforms is the world's largest social media company, which owns Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. The company also owns the world's most popular Virtual Reality platform Oculus, which is expected to be the poster child for its huge investments into the Metaverse.

title: Mega-cap tech stocks are poised to drop as earnings for giants like Alphabet and Meta have left investors 'screaming for financial discipline,' analyst says
text: The New York Stock Exchange's senior market strategist explains what tech earnings mean and how the market could react to the downbeat reports.

title: Forget Meta Platforms And Buy Disney For The Metaverse
text: Meta Platforms releases Q3 earnings. Meta's early metaverse plans were panned by critics.

title: Meta says it's laying off staff and easing off hiring to reduce costs – but will keep pumping billions into Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse
text: Meta's CFO said Wednesday the company was shrinking headcount in some teams, keeping it flat in others, and hiring only for its "highest priorities."

title: Meta shares plunge 23% on downgrades, missed earnings and big spending on metaverse
text: Shares of Meta continued to sell off on Thursday as investors and analysts digested the company's earnings miss and weak outlook.

title: Here's What's Wrong With Meta's Earnings Report
text: Meta's expenses are surging as revenue declines, and some investors are likely losing faith in the company's ability to create meaningful shareholder value.

title: Disappointing earnings from Alphabet, Microsoft and Meta are dragging stocks lower
text: Tech stocks are taking a beating this week as they prove less resilient to the economic downturn than investors had hoped they would be.

title: Meta Platform's VR bet costing Zuckerberg and other investors dear
text: Mark Zuckerberg's personal wealth fell US$76bn and he fell to 23rd on Bloomberg's list of the world's richest people after Meta Platforms shares took another beating overnight. Disappointment with the Facebook, What's App and Instagram owner's recent trading was the cause (read here) Critics say the Facebook founder only has himself to blame and that his obsession with the metaverse (a virtual online world peopled by avatars) represents a grand folly on an industrial scale.

title: Meta employees are bracing for possible layoffs as growth slows and spending on the metaverse soars
text: Meta burned $4 billion on the metaverse this quarter and Mark Zuckerberg vowed Wednesday to spend billions more on the metaverse next year.

title: Meta Shares Plummet 20% In Pre-Market After Q3 Revenue Decline
text: Meta's Reality Labs division, which is leading its metaverse push, reported cumulative losses of $9.4 billion in 2022.

title: Mark Zuckerberg said he was 'pretty confident' Meta is heading in a 'good direction' as its stock crashed 20% after a huge earnings miss
text: Meta's revenue fell for a second consecutive quarter as it ramped up spending on metaverse projects — and said it planned to spend even more.

title: Meta shares crater 20% after its earnings and revenue outlook miss targets
text: Meta's metaverse-related Reality Labs lost $3.7 billion in the third quarter, taking losses this year to $9 billion, and a digital ads slowdown is hitting techs.

title: Meta says it's planning to shrink its office space as more employees are working remotely
text: Meta has embraced remote work, with top executives such as CEO Mark Zuckerberg working from Hawaii and other locations abroad.

title: U.S. stock futures inch up after Meta shocker and as traders nervously eye Apple and Amazon results
text: U.S. stock futures struggled to make much headway Thursday after Meta became the latest tech giant to disappoint and traders nervously awaited earnings from Apple and Amazon.
